apian_creation_defaults.description: A dictionary providing default values for resource creation set by apian

apian_delete_defaults.description: A dictionary providing default values for resource deletion set by apian

apian_fetch_defaults.description: A dictionary providing default values for resource fetches set by apian

apian_query_params.description: Additional query params to add to all URL requests

apian_update_defaults.description: A dictionary providing default values for resource updates set by apian

apian_ur.description: The base URI to which API requests should go.

address.description: For MSG callbacks, the mailbox address to use

delay.description: Seed for an initial random delay before first call, in millisecs.  The actual delay is this value plus a random number in [0, 1000)

fire_once.description: A flag specifying whether callbacks should be called at most once, even if the job is requeued and retraces previous states

order.description: Trigger ordering.  Smaller (or nil) orders are triggered first, with progress callbacks taking preference over state callbacks.  Synchronous and asynchronous callbacks are ordered independently.  Callbacks with the same order, states and synchronicity are triggered in the order they are received.

payload.description: The payload to be used as a message body

progress_variation.description: A number in (0, 1) which gives the variation in progress that will trigger this callback.

register-address.description: For MSG callbacks, whether to register the requested address if it does not yet exist (i.e., whether to create the associated message queue when the mailbox is RabbitMQ)

retries.description: Number of times the callback is retried on failures

retry_delay.description: Seed for a exponential back-off between retries, in millisecs

states.description: A list of states for which the callback should be called. If not given, the callback will be called for either the given progress variation or, if that's not provided, for all state changes

synchronous.description: A flag specifying wether the callback is synchronous and we need to wait for a remote response before proceeding

timeout.description: Lapse in millisecs waiting for the callback to get a response

url.description: The URL to invoke with the method above

creation_defaults.description: A dictionary providing default values for resource creation.

delete_defaults.description: A dictionary providing default values for resource deletion.

fetch_defaults.description: A dictionary providing default values for resource fetches.

inputs.description: Either a list of [name value] pairs or a map from script id to a list of such pairs, to specify the value of the script(s) parameters during execution.

internal.description: When set, resources are manipulated talking directly with wintermute proxies, so this script usable only as an internal script.

logs.description: User logs generated during the execution of the scripts as a list of entries of the form: [level timestamp line-number log-message]

max_execution_steps.description: Maximum allowed number of execution steps. A zero or negative value denotes no limit.

max_execution_time.description: Maximum allowed execution time, in seconds. A zero or negative value denotes no limit.

max_recursion_depth.description: Maximum number of non-tail recursive  nested calls.

output_maps.description: Mapping, in the form of a map from script id to a list of pairs of variable names, from output variables to script parameter names.

last_update.description: The last time, in milliseconds, the resource status. was reported

task.description: Description of the resource construction task under way.

variable.description: Name of the whizzml script variable this resource was assigned to.

output_resources.description: List of resources created during this execution, as a list of maps with resource information

outputs.description: List of names or name/value pairs with the exection outptus.

result.description: The last value computed by the last script executed.

results.description: The values computed by the sxecuted scripts.

script_id.description: The identifier or list of identifiers of the script to execute.

sources.description: List of pairs id/name for all the sources (scripts and libraries) that this execution may refer to in logs and call stacks.

tlp.description: Maximum number of simultaneous, non-finished, resource creation tasks.

update_defaults.description: A dictionary providing default values for resource updates.

username.description: The user to use as owner during execution.
